subject: Management
title: The Eisenhower Matrix for Delegation
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Eisenhower Matrix for Delegation usable.

hook.text: Eisenhower ran a war, a university, and a country. His secret? A 2x2 grid.

buildup.text: Sort tasks by urgency and importance. Urgent but not important? Delegate it.

discovery.text: Most managers spend 60% of their time on urgent-but-unimportant tasks they could hand off.

twist.text: The important-but-not-urgent quadrantâ€”strategy, development, thinkingâ€”gets starved.

climax.text: Delegation frees the manager to live in the quadrant that creates the most long-term value.

punchline.text: Delegate the urgent. Protect the important.

quiz.question: Which tasks should a manager delegate according to the Eisenhower Matrix?
